page.description: HOURGLASS_CURSOR() turns on an hourglass cursor to indicate to the user that a task is being performed, and that he/she should wait until the task is complete. If On_Off_Flag is .T., the hourglass cursor is turned on. If On_Off_Flag is .F., the normal cursor is restored. Use this command in scripts before a long operation is started.

argument.name: show
argument.description: Logical:.T. = Turns on the hourglass cursor, .F. = The normal cursor is restored.

section.title: Example
section.description: This script turns on the hourglass cursor before starting a long operation.
section.example: hourglass_cursor(.T.) tbl = table.current() query.description = "Lastname order" query.filter = "city = 'Boston'" query.order = "LAST_NAME" indx = tbl.query_create() 'Operation complete. Turn off the hourglass cursor. hourglass_cursor(.F.)
